parameters:
Who the hell are you? Marching into our turf like that?
We're busy here!

Karin-san, thanks to you, my illness has been cured. I'm
truly grateful. If you ever have any troubles, don't
hesitate to tell me.

The boss has become bedridden, and it's quite serious...
What on earth should we do...

Softshell turtles are amazing, huh. It's great that the boss
has gotten his energy back thanks to them. Thanks for your
help.
Please hold on, boss of Toramasa...

Who the hell are you!? Barging into our gang's territory
like that! Don't you dare speak so casually to the boss of
Toramasa! You're not welcome here! Get outta here!

Boss, you seem to be in pretty bad shape. Your complexion is
off, and you've lost weight...

Isn't it obvious!? The boss has been bedridden for a long
time!

We've had doctors look at him, but they can't figure out the
cause. We're honestly at a loss here. The medicine is just a
placebo at this point... What should we do...

This... is a soft-shelled turtle I caught at Ueno Pond. I'd
like to feed it to the boss, if that's okay with you?

--What? A soft-shelled turtle? I don't mind, but... Can you
even cook?

My dad used to make soft-shelled turtle stew all the time,
so I've seen it done plenty. I should be fine. May I use the
kitchen?

--Karin prepared the soft-shelled turtle and started boiling
it in the pot.

Alright, it's done! Can I go ahead and feed it to the boss
now?

Wait a minute. I can't let you feed the boss something
strange without checking it first. I'll taste it myself
first.
Ehehe. Then I'll go ahead and feed it to the boss now♪

This is a soft-shelled turtle dish I made. It's full of
nutrients, so please try some.
--Karin fed the soft-shelled turtle stew to the boss.
Seriously!? The boss's face is getting some color back--!?

This is the nourishing dish my dad always made when someone
was sick. I remember eating it whenever I caught a cold and
it always helped me recover quickly. It's a memorable soft-
shelled turtle stew.
Boss! Is it really okay for you to get out of bed!?

Ah, you all have been through a lot because of me. No need
to worry anymore. I'm fine now--
Ugh! That's a relief...! The boss's health is recovering...

I'm glad your health has improved. Well then, I'll be on my
way--

Hey hey, wait a moment. Let me at least thank you. Hey guys,
get some tea ready quickly! This young lady here saved my
life.

...Phew. Finished the whole pot. It was seriously delicious.
I feel like I've been brought back to life. What's your
name, young lady?

My name is Karin. I live near the dumpling shop in the
castle town and sometimes help out there.

This soft-shelled turtle stew, you said it was a dish filled
with memories of your father. Has he passed away?

No, he went missing five years ago... I've been searching
for him ever since...
That's unfortunate. What's your father's name?
--! Eh!? Boss, you know my father?

Yeah. More than 10 years ago, during a conflict with another
group. He came to help our gang... He was incredibly strong.
In a duel by the riverbank, he took down more than a hundred
men--and what's amazing is he did it without using a sword,
and without injuring any of them, just knocking them out.
(So that was it... It's the first time I've heard this.)

Despite being incredibly strong, he never boasted, was kind
and dashing. Ah, the memories... To think that I'd be saved
by the daughter of that Chuutarou, with a soft-shelled
turtle stew no less, today is indeed an auspicious day.
Ahaha! I'm happy to hear such a good story too.

I want to give you something in return. Is there anything
you want, Karin-san?

...Well, you see, sometimes I work as a nightingale...
and... if possible, I'd like you to keep your underlings
quiet at night... I mean, I'd like to be able to move freely
through the streets at night.

Huh!? You work as a nightingale too? You look like an
ordinary town girl... That's surprising.

That's an easy request. This area is our turf, so I'll make
sure my guys don't bother Karin-san. I'll pass the word
along.

Karin-san, we won't interfere with your work again. You're
free to do whatever you need to at night.

That alone doesn't satisfy me. This is for the soft-shelled
turtle. It's not much, but please accept it.

--Karin received \c[17]5000 mon\c[0] as a token of
gratitude!

(Nourishing food... If I remember correctly, my father used
to eat soft-shelled turtles when he wasn't feeling well... I
should go catch some at [Ueno Pond].)

Kisanosuke: "What are you still doing wandering around here?
Hurry up and go home."

Karin: "This... is a soft-shelled turtle I caught in Ueno
Pond. May I prepare it for the boss to eat?"

Kisanosuke: "What? A soft-shelled turtle? I don't mind,
but... can you even cook?"

Karin: "I've seen my father make turtle hotpot many times,
so I should be fine. May I use the kitchen?"

Karin skillfully butchered the turtle and put it in the pot
to boil.

Karin: "Alright, it's done! May I serve it to the boss right
away?"

Kisanosuke: "Hold on a second. I can't let the boss eat
something strange without checking it first. I'll taste it
myself."
Karin: "Ehehe. Then, I'll serve it to the boss now♪"

Karin: "It's a soft-shelled turtle dish I made. It's full of
nutrients, so please try some."
Karin served the soft-shelled turtle hotpot to the boss.

Kisanosuke: "Seriously!? The boss's face is full of
life--!?"

Karin: "It's a nourishing dish for the sick that my father
always made. I remember eating it when I had a cold and it
helped me recover quickly."

Kisanosuke: "Boss! Is it really okay for you to get out of
bed!?"

Boss: "Ah. You all have been through a lot of trouble for
me. No need to worry anymore. I'm fine--"

Omitsu: "Uuu! I'm so glad...! The boss's condition has
improved..."

Karin: "I'm glad your health has improved. Well then, I'll
be taking my leave--"

Boss: "Hey, hey, wait a minute. Let me at least thank you.
Hey, you guys. Prepare some tea quickly! This young lady is
the savior of my life."

Boss: "...Phew. Finished the whole pot. It was seriously
delicious. This old tiger feels revived. What's your name,
young lady?"

Karin: "My name is Karin. I live near the dumpling shop in
the castle town and sometimes help out there."

Boss: "This soft-shelled turtle hotpot, you said it's a dish
with memories of your father, but has he passed away?"

Karin: "No. The thing is, he went missing five years ago...
I've been searching for him ever since..."
Boss: "That's unfortunate. What's your father's name?"
Karin: "--! Eh!? You know my father, boss?"

Boss: "Yeah. Over ten years ago, during a conflict with
another group, he came to help us out... He was incredibly
strong. In a duel by the riverbank, he took down over a
hundred men--and what was amazing was that he didn't use a
sword and didn't injure anyone, just knocked them out with
his holds."

(So that was his story... I'm hearing this for the first
time.)

Despite being incredibly strong, he never boasted, was kind
and had a dashing air about him. Ah, it brings back
memories... To think that I'd be saved by the daughter of
that Chuutarou, and treated to his soft-shelled turtle
hotpot, today is indeed an auspicious day.
Ahaha! I'm happy to hear such a nice story too.

I want to give you something in return. Is there anything
you want, Karin-san?

...Well, you see, sometimes I work as a courtesan... so...
if possible, I'd like you to keep your underlings in check
during the night... I mean, I'd like to be able to move
freely through the streets at night.

Heh!? You work as a courtesan too? You look like an ordinary
town girl... that's surprising.

That's an easy request. This area is our turf, so I'll make
sure my guys don't mess with Karin-san. I'll pass the word
along.

Karin-san, we won't interfere with your work again. You're
free to do whatever you want at night.

That alone doesn't satisfy me. This is for the soft-shelled
turtle. It's not much, but please accept it.

--Karin received \c[17]5000 mon\c[0] as a token of
gratitude!

I really owe you one. Even in the safe streets of Edo, it's
become dangerous at night lately... Several night hawks have
been kidnapped, so we can't let our guard down. The culprit
hasn't been caught yet, so be careful, Karin-san.
